page.title: 19Local History:Seed Farm
page.content: The{old manor house}at Cradley dates back to the 10th century and successive generations altered and added to it. Today the oldest part is the kitchen and the{medieval chapel, dovecot, tudor and georgian windows and{daub and wattle}still remain. The {moat}which surrounded the house was partially blocked in 1910 but still remains alomng the sides and back of the house. The house was used as a farm house until 1982 but is now a country house. The owners have done much to restore and preserve its old features. The barn next to the house has been converted to a lounge and the stream which ran beneath it has been diverted into the moat. {Elizabethan wall} {paintings}have been covered to prevent fading and the old{bread oven}and fireplace have been restored.
